commitMessage:
feat(checkpoint): add /checkpoint command for conversation state preservation

## What Changed
- Added `.claude/commands/checkpoint.md` (422 lines) - comprehensive slash command template
- Modified `src/commands/context.ts` to discover and display checkpoint files
  - Added `discoverCheckpoints()` method with glob pattern matching and sorting
  - Integrated checkpoint discovery into `loadFeatureContext()` workflow
- Created `src/commands/checkpoint.smoke.test.ts` with 5 test cases
- Fixed semgrep certificate warning in `.hodge/toolchain.yaml` (Boy Scout Rule)
- Fixed 10 pre-existing nullish coalescing warnings in `src/commands/context.ts` (Boy Scout Rule)
- Added nullish coalescing operator standard to `.hodge/standards.md` for token efficiency

## Why This Change
The `/checkpoint` command formalizes conversation state preservation across `/clear` operations. Previously, context was lost when clearing conversations, forcing users to manually recreate state. The checkpoint command uses YAML format for token-efficient state capture and restoration.

The nullish coalescing standard addition prevents future ESLint warning cycles by ensuring AI writes code correctly from the start, rather than fixing violations post-hoc.

## Impact
- Users can preserve conversation state across `/clear` operations
- Token-efficient YAML format reduces context overhead
- Checkpoint files are automatically discovered and displayed when loading feature context
- Future code will use `??` instead of `||` proactively, avoiding fix cycles
- Cleaner codebase with semgrep warning eliminated and nullish coalescing violations fixed

## Testing
- All 5 smoke tests passing for checkpoint discovery functionality
- 131 test files, 1334 tests passing (100% pass rate)
- No ESLint errors, only pre-existing warnings in unrelated files
